Items.Title: Application No. N 160051 ZRY submitted by the New York City Department of City Planning pursuant to Section 201 of the New York City Charter, for an amendment of the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York, to create the Mandatory Inclusionary Housing program that would require, through zoning actions, a share of new housing to be permanently affordable.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Hearing Held by Committee

Items.Title: Application No. N 160049 ZRY submitted by the New York City Department of City Planning pursuant to Section 201 of the New York City Charter, for an amendment of the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York, to modify various sections to change definitions and regulations for bulk and parking.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Hearing Held by Committee

Items.Title: Application No. N 160051 ZRY submitted by the New York City Department of City Planning pursuant to Section 201 of the New York City Charter, for an amendment of the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York, to create the Mandatory Inclusionary Housing program that would require, through zoning actions, a share of new housing to be permanently affordable.
Items.ActionName: Approved by Subcommittee with Modifications and Referred to CPC
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved by Subcommittee with Modifications and Referred to CPC approved by Roll Call.

Items.Title: Application No. N 160049 ZRY submitted by the New York City Department of City Planning pursuant to Section 201 of the New York City Charter, for an amendment of the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York, to modify various sections to change definitions and regulations for bulk and parking.
Items.ActionName: Approved by Subcommittee with Modifications and Referred to CPC
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved by Subcommittee with Modifications and Referred to CPC approved by Roll Call.

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Greenfield, Cohen and Barron
